script.text: Local Panel TY_KN_01 New hardware detected. Connect to the Cybernet to look for drivers? > N > DreamTransfer.tx DREAM DATA AUDIO/VIDEO TRANSFER PROGRAM -K1D NE0N > LATEST COZMO77.DDF > CONVERT COZMO77 PLEASE WAIT... COZMO77.TDF SUCCESSFULLY CREATED > exit

Local Panel TY_KN_01 > datasheet.txt cozmo77.tdf -scanner For help, please type ? or 'help' > datasheet.txt cozmo77.tdf -scan For help, please type ? or 'help' > hey TAL Hello, Dr. Neon! Did you mean to type -analyze? > what's the analyze argument > oh > ty Is there anything else I can help with? > not atm Understood. > datasheet.txt cozmo77.tdf -analyze SIRENS, COMMON ANALYZING. PLEASE WAIT. . . . DONE. > list SUBJ_1 SUBJ_2 SUBJ_3 SUBJ_4 SUBJ_5 SUBJ_6 > display subj_1 - subj_6

SUBJ_1 - IMAGE_BIGTALL Hereditary influence: None Environmental influence: High Language: Audio scans detect similarities to Abyssal. Affinity: None detected, suggesting Spirit or a variant. Weaknesses: No data available. Resistances: No data available.

Neon Note: Build suggests immense physical strength and agility. Despite appearances, its claws are dull. Sirens prefer dealing crushing blows to slashing, as crushing is less likely to kill a fleeing victim.
Note to self: Ask Cozmo if freckles are real, and if markings around eyes are natural or eyeliner. Sirens aren't ever found on Owel, so how do they possess knowledge of common cosmetic markings?

SUBJ_2 - IMAGE_BEEHAIR Hereditary influence: None Environmental influence: High Language: Audio scans detect similarities to Abyssal. Affinity: None detected, suggesting Spirit or its variants. Weaknesses: No data available. Resistances: No data available.

Neon Note: The appearance of this siren makes no sense, aesthetically speaking. It may be attempting to camouflage itself as one of the local trees. The presence of the highly venomous bee abominations gives my hypothesis some validity. Its elongated eyelashes are similar to those of the bees, suggesting that it is capable of controlling them, or communicating with them. The bees detected Cozmo almost as soon as he stepped foot into the gorge, which must have been the reason the Sirens knew of his impending arrival.

SUBJ_3 - IMAGE_ONEARM Hereditary influence: None Environmental influence: High Language: Audio scans detect similarities to Abyssal. Affinity: None detected, suggesting Spirit or its variants. Weaknesses: No data available. Resistances: No data available.

Neon Note: This siren seems to have sacrificed its individual "beauty" in favor of utility. Its comparatively plain body and stoic expression forces one's eyes to look at the flowers it wears. Initial scans suggest that these flowers are capable of rotating, which would almost certainly produce a hypnotic effect. This would validate theories of individuals being controlled by Sirens.

Note to self: Ask Cozmo if flowers can spin.

SUBJ_4 - IMAGE_FLOWERBALL Hereditary influence: None Environmental influence: High Language: Audio scans detect similarities to Abyssal. Affinity: None detected, suggesting Spirit or its variants. Weaknesses: No data available. Resistances: No data available.

Neon Note: The smallest and "cutest" of the bunch. Cultivating an appearance of meekness and timidity is a proven Siren strategy. And the rosy cheeks are evidence that Sirens are capable of learning what our cultures find appealing. The flower attachment is most likely a lure, similar to that of a deep-sea anglerfish. Probably contains some kind of contact or airborne poison.
End of file.
> list SUBJ_1 SUBJ_2 SUBJ_3 SUBJ_4 > list subj_5 subj_6 SUBJ_1 SUBJ_2 SUBJ_3 SUBJ_4 > display subj_5

SUBJ_5 - No data available Hereditary influence: No data available Environmental influence: No data available Language: No data available Affinity: No data available Weaknesses: No data available. Resistances: No data available.
>   display subj_4

SUBJ_4 - IMAGE_FLOWERBALL Hereditary influence: None Environmental influence: High Language: Audio scans detect similarities to Abyssal. Affinity: None detected, suggesting Spirit or its variants. Weaknesses: No data available. Resistances: No data available.

Neon Note: The smallest and "cutest" of the bunch. Cultivating an appearance of meekness and timidity is a proven Siren strategy. And the rosy cheeks are evidence that Sirens are capable of learning what our cultures find appealing. The flower attachment is most likely a lure, similar to that of a deep-sea anglerfish. Probably contains some kind of contact or airborne poison.
> display subj_5

SUBJ_5 - No data available Hereditary influence: No data available Environmental influence: No data available Language: No data available Affinity: No data available Weaknesses: No data available. Resistances: No data available.

> what?? > TAL what's wrong with the image There does not appear to be anything wrong with it. Could you be more specific about the problem you are experiencing? > it's glitching uot > out* > i can't tell what it's supposed to be at all; there are streaks of purple and white Are you able to view the other images? > i could see subj1-4 and just rechecked one to be sure and it's still fine; 5 is the one that has issues

> wait does that mean you can see it Yes. > can you see subj1 through 6?? I can see subj1-5. > okay > um > what does subj5 look like? a short desc is fine. A dainty, purple horse. Pink leaves adorning a long white mane and tail. Face with three eyes. Would you like more detail? > no that's good, thanks. i'll just troubleshoot it later and add more observations myself.

Is there anything else I can do for you? > no. thanks though. > wait yes actually > what about subj_6??? What are you referring to? > what? there were 6 in the original list, can you see it or not I do not see a subj_6. > ugh > okay. thanks.
>  display   subj_6

SUB J_ 6 - SUBJ_1 SUBJ_2 SUBJ_3 SUBJ_4 SUBJ_5 SUBJ_6 SUBJ_1 SUBJ_2 SUBJ_3 SUBJ_4 SUBJ_5 SUBJ_6 SUBJ_1 SUBJ_2 SUBJ_3 SUBJ_4 SUBJ_5 SUBJ_6 SUBJ_1 SUBJ_2 SUBJ_3 SUBJ_4 SUBJ_5 SUBJ_6 SUBJ_1 SUBJ_2 SUBJ_3 SUBJ_4 SUBJ_5 SUBJ_6 SUBJ_1 SUBJ_2 SUBJ_3 SUBJ_4 SUBJ_5 SUBJ_6 SUBJ_1 SUBJ_2 SUBJ_3 SUBJ_4 SUBJ_5 SUBJ_6 SUBJ_1 SUBJ_2 SUBJ_3 SUBJ_4 SUBJ_5 SUBJ_6 SUBJ_1 SUBJ_2 SUBJ_3 SUBJ_4 SUBJ_5 SUBJ_6 SUBJ_1 SUBJ_2 SUBJ_3 SUBJ_4 SUBJ_5 SUBJ_6 SUBJ_1 SUBJ_2 SUBJ_3 SUBJ_4 SUBJ_5 SUBJ_6 SUBJ_1 SUBJ_2 SUBJ_3 SUBJ_4 SUBJ_5 SUBJ_6 SUBJ_1 SUBJ_2 SUBJ_3 SUBJ_4 SUBJ_5 SUBJ_6 SUBJ_1 SUBJ_2 SUBJ_3 SUBJ_4 SUBJ_5 SUBJ_6 SUBJ_1 SUBJ_2 SUBJ_3 SUBJ_4 SUBJ_5 SUBJ_6 SUBJ_1 SUBJ_2 SUBJ_3 SUBJ_4 SUBJ_5 SUBJ_6 SUBJ_1 SUBJ_2 SUBJ_3 SUBJ_4 SUBJ_5 SUBJ_6 SUBJ_1 SUBJ_2 SUBJ_3 SUBJ_4 SUBJ_5 SUBJ_6 SUBJ_1 SUBJ_2 SUBJ_3 SUBJ_4 SUBJ_5 SUBJ_6 SUBJ_1 SUBJ_2 SUBJ_3 SUBJ_4 SUBJ_5 SUBJ_6...
Too many results to display. Try refining your search. > display "subj_6" PLEASE WAIT. ...DONE. > list PLEASE WAIT. ...DONE. > list all PLE AS E WA IT. ...DONE. > list subj_6 P L E A S E W A I T.
Local Panel TY_KN_01 > datasheet.txt cozmo77.tdf -restore_backup PLEA SE WAI T.

Local Panel TY_KN_01 > oh my god what > TAL please tell me there's a backup of my data There has been no activity on my end. I can only restore data from remote panels. Are you on a local panel? > oh > my > god Is there anything I can do to help? > asjhgfjhdgg > i'll just try to restore it on my end > god damnit REBOOTING. PLEASE WAIT. > stop > abort

Local Panel TY_KN_01 New hardware detected. Connect to the Cybernet to look for drivers? > NO Installing drivers. > stop > abort > x > ^X ERROR ERROR ERROR ERROR ERROR ERROR ERROR ERROR ERROR ERROR ERROR ERROR ERROR ERROR ERROR ERROR ERROR ERROR ERROR ERROR ERROR ERROR ERROR ERROR ERROR ERROR ERROR ERROR ERROR ERROR ERROR ERROR ERROR ERROR ERROR Hardware-level failure detected. Installation cannot continue.
